channel.title: Book Review
channel.description: The world's top authors and critics join Sunday Book Review Editor Sam Tanenhaus in lively conversations about books, arts and ideas.
channel.itunes:author: The New York Times
channel.itunes:subtitle: The newest releases and literary trends.
channel.itunes:summary: The world's top authors and critics join Sunday Book Review Editor Sam Tanenhaus in lively conversations about books, arts and ideas.

item.itunes:author: Sam Tanenhaus
item.title: Book Review Podcast
item.description: This week, Emily Bazelon talks about “Sticks and Stones,” her new book about bullying; Phillip Lopate discusses the craft of essay writing; and Gregory Cowles has best-seller news. Sam Tanenhaus is the host.

item.itunes:author: Sam Tanenhaus
item.title: Book Review Podcast
item.description: This week, Teddy Wayne talks about his novel “The Love Song of Jonny Valentine”; Leslie Kaufman has notes from the field; Caryn James discusses “Gods Like Us,” Ty Burr’s new book about movie stardom; and Gregory Cowles has best-seller news. Sam Tanenhaus is the host.

item.itunes:author: Sam Tanenhaus
item.title: Book Review Podcast
item.description: This week, John Burt discusses “Lincoln’s Tragic Pragmatism”; Leslie Kaufman has notes from the field; Jeffrey Frank talks about Richard Nixon and Dwight D. Eisenhower; and Gregory Cowles has best-seller news. Sam Tanenhaus is the host.

item.itunes:author: Sam Tanenhaus
item.title: Book Review Podcast
item.description: This week, Karen Russell talks about “Vampires in the Lemon Grove”; Leslie Kaufman has notes from the field; Adam Kirsch discusses two new biographies of Sylvia Plath; and Gregory Cowles has best-seller news. Sam Tanenhaus is the host.

item.itunes:author: Sam Tanenhaus
item.title: Book Review Podcast
item.description: This week, Christoph Irmscher discusses the life of the scientist Louis Agassiz; Leslie Kaufman has notes from the field; Timothy Naftali talks about Richard Nixon; and Gregory Cowles has best-seller news. Sam Tanenhaus is the host.

item.itunes:author: Sam Tanenhaus
item.title: Book Review Podcast
item.description: This week, Joe Queenan talks about his reading habits; Leslie Kaufman has notes from the field; J. D. Biersdorfer discusses new apps about famous wars; and Gregory Cowles has best-seller news. Sam Tanenhaus is the host.

item.itunes:author: Sam Tanenhaus
item.title: Book Review Podcast
item.description: This week, Lawrence Wright discusses Scientology; Leslie Kaufman has notes from the field; Emily Bazelon talks about Sonia Sotomayor’s new memoir; and Gregory Cowles has best-seller news. Sam Tanenhaus is the host.

item.itunes:author: Sam Tanenhaus
item.title: Book Review Podcast
item.description: This week, Bill Keller discusses three new books about nuclear weapons; Leslie Kaufman has notes from the field; Susan Chira talks about Susanna Sonnenberg’s “She Matters”; and Gregory Cowles has best-seller news. Sam Tanenhaus is the host.

item.itunes:author: Sam Tanenhaus
item.title: Book Review Podcast
item.description: This week, John Homans talks about “What’s a Dog For?”; Leslie Kaufman has notes from the field; Allan Kozinn discusses Kurt Weill and Lotte Lenya; and Gregory Cowles has best-seller news. Sam Tanenhaus is the host.

item.itunes:author: Sam Tanenhaus
item.title: Book Review Podcast
item.description: This week, Jami Attenberg discusses her novel “The Middlesteins”; Leslie Kaufman has notes from the field; Maxwell Carter talks about “The Art Forger” by B. A. Shapiro; and Gregory Cowles has best-seller news. Sam Tanenhaus is the host.
